channel.title: Project Marcbob
channel.description:
Welcome to the Development Team thread for Project Marcbob. The current base we are looking to build off is Rune-Legacy. My past servers have all been very successful because of my advertising and marketing skills. I am hoping to have this be one of my best servers yet.
One of the things I have failed to do in my past servers is have a strong staff team to take some of the stress off myself and to create a better server. My last server hit 70+ online and I think I had one in game moderator and I was not on as much as I should have been at the time.
[b]Goals of the server:[/b] [i]-Hit 150+ before the end of July. -Become 100% user friendly. -Average around 100 forum users online at the best times. -No glitches and every skill trainable. (2 Left to do) -Some custom bosses and items with custom attack styles. -Great Staff team. -Well thought out donation system and benefits.[/i]
Now about the positions I am looking to fill.
[b]1. Website Developer[/b]: I only need one person who is very experienced for this. There are several things which I need done that are very basic, such as a homepage for the website. Also, I need some things that I am willing to pay for which are a Toplist, webclient maker with loaders, and integrated features which I will bring up with someone interested. I really am not willing to pay much for this and I really shouldn't even have to offer money for this position.
[b]2. 2006/2007 Remake developer[/b]: This is a 100% paid position and I am only looking to buy a nearly completed remake which will act as a world 2 or possibly a different server. I am only interested in good remakes. I'm 99% sure I will never end up buying one.
[b]3. Project Marcbob server developer[/b]: I am looking for 1-2 server developers to help complete custom and original content. We are looking to have lots of original features that have never been seen before.
[b][u][i]-Other information on positions: If you are looking to make money but can't do anything mentioned above please message me on MSN or on my website. I can give you other stuff to do.[/i][/u][/b]
[code] Name: Age: What are you applying for? Experience: Do you have any special skills that relate to a RSPS? Why should I choose you?[/code]
Thanks for reading and good luck to those who apply. My budget alone for the 2006/2007 remake is around $200 but obviously I won't pay that for just anything. I have been offered lots of servers but they have all been pretty bad.
[b][u]I am also looking to partner who is into running minecraft servers. I would love to have one be apart of the website.[/u][/b]

item.title: Project Marcbob
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

marcbob:

You should have PMed me for details then

Because I knew you, the owner, wouldn’t have gave me any. There is no where on your thread that says to PM you for details. You only ask for people to apply. Not to test my skills. I’ll build a webpage with enough given details. As everyone is unique and I’m NOT going to know exactly what you like and how you want something styled.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Marcbob
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:49, topic:448115”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=551008.msg4043279#msg4043279 date=1341850968]

I’m finishing a couple things with Asshole_Rule. Once they are finished I will probably get an additional server developer. The only server developers I still need are for the 06 Remake side project.

Also, I still need a website developer. A homepage is needed still and making one is a way to get the job.

I replied to you asking for details on what you’d like on a homepage…
I never got anything back

I just want something that looks nice. I’m not picky as long as overall it looks good. If I have to pick images and everything for you I might as well do it…
[/quote]
Well I’ve never played any of your servers, I don’t even know the name of them or the site I’m making a page for. So how am I supposed to make a site for it?
If you have a logo and perhaps a name I could go from there.[/quote]

You should have PMed me for details then

Read full topic

item.title: Project Marcbob
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

marcbob:

Prove yourself by making me a good homepage. If I like it you got the job.

I can make a homepage easy.
It’s what you want that makes it unique.
What images do you want on there?
Color scheme?
Nav-bar? Yes/No?
Image links?
Header, footer?
Slideshow?
I need as much detail as possible before I can make you a homepage mate.

Experience: I’m currently enrolled in a secondary school for web design, this will be my second year attending. I work on websites all the time, and in my free time. I know the 4 major browser languages, html, css, php, and javascript. Come spring 2013 (when I’m 18) I’ll be getting my certifications in them.
I have lots of proof just not taking my time to post it in this thread.
Do you have any special skills that relate to a RSPS? Um… Well. I know how to make a catchy site/banner… Web design doesn’t go in this category really…
Why should I choose you? Because the word because.[/quote]

Name: Nicholas Armstrong
Age: 16
What are you applying for? Project Marcbob Developer
Experience: Few projects, can show over MSN.
Do you have any special skills that relate to a RSPS? I know the protocol pretty well, I have been programming for 2 years, I know how to carry a team.
Why should I choose you? I have been around the community for about 2 years, I have seen your other projects, I was never able to program back then, but I am extremely able to now. I created 2 frameworks by myself(to the point of login) and I want to get on a project where I will actually learn something.

Writing a framework to the point of login and then qutting, is like taking a dump and wiping your ass.

Easy.
[/quote]

That’s why you failed on your framework a year or so ago. :|[/quote]

Because I only got to login and then quit? Derp.
